name: UiPathPack
description: Packages an existing UiPath project into a NuGet package.
author: UiPath

inputs.name: versionType
inputs.label: Choose versioning method
inputs.helpMarkDown: UiPath package versions can be generated automatically, manually from a specified version, or read from the project file. Auto-generating the version works similarly to how Studio performs the versioning when publishing a package.

options.CurrentVersion: Use the version specified in the project file

inputs.name: version
inputs.label: Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifying the package version manually provides the possibility of tracking the built packages and their source versioning more efficiently. For example, the Microsoft assembly pattern can be utilized to build the NuGet package version: [Major].[Minor].[BuildNumber].[RevisionNumber]

inputs.name: projectJsonPath
inputs.label: Project(s) Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The location of the project(s) to be packaged. It can be a direct path to a project.json file or a directory with one or multiple projects. In the latter case, each level one project is packaged individually.

inputs.name: outputPath
inputs.label: Output Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to a folder, where the created package should be placed.
